content: Not sure what mine was in 1969, but I think it was $97. Dads first was for a weekend drill with the Texas NG in 1939...2 silver dollars!

content: When I was forced to join the Army by my towns chief of police I was making $78.00 take home pay and I thought I was a little under paid at the time. So I did what most educated people did in the Army back in those days to make extra money. I went Airborne and got an extra $55.00 a month in my pay check.

content: quote: Originally posted by DSTremf: Well, that was back in the day when gas was .20 cents a gallon. Not in Germany - it was $2.00, and I never could figure the difference between liters and gallons - I got about $50.00 out of my first months pay after taxes and the Drill Sergeant taking his cut from everybody for shoe shine supplies etc. - what a rip-off!! Wandering and Wondering

content: This July will be 40 years when I placed my feet on the 'yellow footprints' at Parris Island, SC. The pay for an E-1 with less than 6 months was a whole $79/month. A "Class Q Allotment" was taken out monthly for a $25 Savings Bond. MY PEBD (Pre-Entry Base Date) is next Friday, the 13th...delayed enlistment.
reply: This July will be 40 years when I placed my feet on the 'yellow footprints' at Parris Island, SC. The pay for an E-1 with less than 6 months was a whole $79/month. A "Class Q Allotment" was taken out monthly for a $25 Savings Bond. MY PEBD (Pre-Entry Base Date) is next Friday, the 13th...delayed enlistment.
title: How  come I only got $58.00 a month when i joined ?

content: quote: Originally posted by mikeyR8: quote: Originally posted by stillkit: Not sure what mine was in 1969, but I think it was $97. Dads first was for a weekend drill with the Texas NG in 1939...2 silver dollars! I think it was $108.00 a month in 69, and if you were married Ya got a whopping $60.00 Class Q allotment. Course My memory is slipping. You're right. My first pay check was minus a $10 advance they gave us all at the Reception Station, so it would have been $98 instead of the $97 I said. As a measure of how much things changed, my LAST pay check was as a maxed out Reserve CPT on active duty back in the late 80's. I made just over $4000!
quote: Originally posted by mikeyR8: quote: Originally posted by stillkit: Not sure what mine was in 1969, but I think it was $97. Dads first was for a weekend drill with the Texas NG in 1939...2 silver dollars! I think it was $108.00 a month in 69, and if you were married Ya got a whopping $60.00 Class Q allotment. Course My memory is slipping.
reply: You're right. My first pay check was minus a $10 advance they gave us all at the Reception Station, so it would have been $98 instead of the $97 I said. As a measure of how much things changed, my LAST pay check was as a maxed out Reserve CPT on active duty back in the late 80's. I made just over $4000!
title: How  come I only got $58.00 a month when i joined ?

content: My first paycheck in the Army was $52.00. Out of that I had to pay for Laundry, shoe polish and all of the other things that I was supposed to buy in basic training. Of course that was in 1961. I believe that a private now makes more than I did as a Staff Sergeant. I made more as a Warrant Officer but not much more.

content: Wow GWG,,,We bothh hit reception center on Feb, 27th. Me in 1962. Which happins to be my birthday, what a stinkeen present. Was a drill at Knox in 67, 5th Trnig Brigade,K Company. Then I got out.

content: I enlisted, so I can't gripe. Really thought to remain a "lifer," but the Viet Nam wind-down, the "All-Volunteer" mess, and rampant drug use (most of my platoon was stoned all the time), pretty much sent me packing in '73. Kinda wish I'd stuck with it. But I don't regret switching to Air Force in '84, and officer pay was sure a lot better than enlisted... Wandering and Wondering
